messages.title: WATFORD DECIDES
messages.content: On May 6th, the people of Watford will play a key role in deciding if David Cameron replaces Gordon Brown in Downing Street.

messages.title: Voting Conservative means we...
messages.content: Act now on debt to get the economy moving. Get Britain working by boosting enterprise. Make Britain the most family-friendly country in Europe. Take back the NHS. Change politics. Raise standards in schools. Rebuilding trust in politics.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Act now on debt to get the economy moving.
Get Britain working by boosting enterprise.
Make Britain the most family-friendly country in Europe.

mentions.tacticalSituation: A conservative victory here requires a swing of just 1.97% from Labour.

issues.economy: Act now on debt to get the economy moving. Cutting the deficit more quickly than Labour so that mortgage rates stay lower for longer with the Conservatives.
issues.education: Give schools the power to restore discipline, and create new technical academies.
issues.governance: Rebuild the number of MPs, cut Whitehall and quangos by a third, and let taxpayers see where their money is spent.
issues.health: Watford Hospital safe in Conservative hands. David Cameron will protect spending on the NHS if he becomes Prime Minister.

leaflet.personalStatement: Richard Harrington, the local Conservative Parliamentary candidate, has pledged to fight a clean and honest campaign and to retain focus on Watford's general election. Richard is committed to greater transparency and accountability in politics and has signed up to the following pledge.

contactInformation.address: Richard Harrington Campaign Office: Watford Conservatives, 1st Floor, The Parade, 38 The Parade, High Street, Watford WD17 1NA

images.caption: Richard Harrington with David Cameron visiting a local business in Watford.
